parameter.name: latitude
parameter.description: The latitude of the location this tweet refers to.

parameter.name: longitude
parameter.description: The longitude of the location this tweet refers to

parameter.name: query
parameter.description: Free-form text to match against while executing a geo-based query

parameter.name: ip
parameter.description: This is the minimal granularity of place types to return and must be one of: poi, neighborhood, city, admin or country

parameter.name: granularity
parameter.description: When set to either true, t or 1, each Tweet returned in a timeline will include a user object including only the status authors numerical ID

parameter.name: accuracy
parameter.description: A hint on the “region” in which to search. If a number, then this is a radius in meters, but it can also take a string that is suffixed with ft to specify feet. If this is not passed in, then it is assumed to be 0m. If coming from a device, in practice, this value is whatever accuracy the device has measuring its location

parameter.name: maxResults
parameter.description: If you upload Tweet media that might be considered sensitive content such as nudity, violence, or medical procedures, you should set this value to true

parameter.name: containedWithin
parameter.description: The latitude of the location this tweet refers to.
